location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.344 of 1858 from Captain Felix Jones, Political Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Henry Anderson, Secretary to the Government of Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter is a covering letter, enclosing an administrative report containing narratives of events for Muscat and the Wahabee [Wahhābī] and Maritime Arab tribes, covering the period 1 May 1856 to 30 April 1858. Jones writes that the report has been prepared by his assistant, Lieutenant Disbrowe, and adds that a further report on events on the Persian coast will follow without delay.The report (folios 41-95) is arranged first by tribe or geographic area, and second by administrative period, as follows:Joasmee [Qāsimī] tribe during the administrative period 1 May 1856 to 30 April 1857 (beginning folio 41), followed by the period 1 May 1857 to 30 April 1858 (folio 51);Beniyas [Banī Yās], 1856/57 (folio 55) and 1857/58 (folio 62);Amulgavine [Umm al-Qaywayn], Debai [Dubai] and Ejman [Ajman], 1856/57 (folio 64);Boo Fulasa, 1856/57 (folio 66) and 1857/58 (folio 67);Ajman and Umm al-Qaywayn, 1857/58 (folio 70);Wahabee [Wahhābī], 1856/57 (folio 73) and 1857/58 (folio 75);Uttoobees [ʿUtūb], 1856/57 (folios 76) and 1857/58 (folio 84);Muscat, 1856/57 (folio 88) and 1857/58 (folio 92)
